item.title: cmsmanager_variables
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================


Subject: deployed cmsmanager is not created with the latest and correct parameters. After deployment, this file will need to be manually populated in order for the app to work. 

Revision History:
    2017-08-11 09:49:00 - Version 1 created by Andrew O'Dell
    

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)


Note: Here is what the /etc/init/syndication_cmsmanager_stg.conf should look like:




description 'syndication_cmsmanager_stg'

start on runlevel [2345]
stop on runlevel [016]

env MYSQL_PASSWORD="-----put something here-----"
env CMSMANAGER_DB_URL="jdbc:mysql://hhs-rds-shared-java-ruby-stg-1.ctkqhucn2qcz.us-east-1.rds.amazonaws.com:3306/cmsmanager_stage"
env CMSMANAGER_MAPPINGBASE="/api/v1/mediaMappings"
env CMSMANAGER_DEFAULTPASSWORD="-----put something here-----"
env CMSMANAGER_SERVER_URL="https://stage-cmsmanager.digitalmedia.hhs.gov"
env MYSQL_USER="synd_stage"
env CMSMANAGER_ADMINUSERNAME="syndicationAdmin@hhs.gov"
env MAIL_PORT="25"
env MAIL_HOST=localhost
env MAIL_DEFAULT_FROM=syndicationAdmin@hhs.gov
env CMSMANAGER_VERIFYAUTHPATH=/api/v1/authorizations.json
env CMSMANAGER_SELFAUTHPATH=/api/v1/debug/status.json
env CMSMANAGER_PUBLICKEY='-----put something here-----'
env CMSMANAGER_PRIVATEKEY='-----put something here-----'
env CMSMANAGER_SECRET='-----put something here-----'
env CMSMANAGER_HELPEMAILADDRESS="syndicationAdmin@hhs.gov"

chdir /appdata/syndication_cmsmanager_stg
setuid cmsmanager

exec /usr/bin/java -Xmx768m -Xms256m -Dgrails.env=prod -Dserver.port=8081 -jar /appdata/syndication_cmsmanager_stg/*.war >> /appdata/syndication_cmsmanager_stg/cmsmanager.log &

item.title: syndication deployment tips
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Syndication Deployment Information

Revision History:
    2015-02-17 14:16:48 - Version 1 created by Paul Rigor
    2015-03-09 18:57:00 - Added s3 bucket info - prigor
    2015-03-11 06:30:00 - Added additional deployment info. - prigor
    2015-03-16 17:39:00 - Corrections - prigor
    2015-04-06 15:30:00 - Added additional scripts to move war files - prigor
    2015-04-29 08:00:00 - Added information on 
    2015-06-22 09:22:00 - Updated manet instructions for new HHS environment (java-app user)
    2015-06-24 07:16:00 - Added tiny url test - prigor
    2016-08-16 07:16:00 - Updated syndication server hostnames. added section on automated deploy script
    2017-01-23 23:12:00 - Updated manet start procedures
    2017-03-02 10:09:00 - added instructions to check App Info
    2017-04-21 07:21:00 - corrected the startup/shutdown script location

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)


There are 2 approaches to deploying syndication:
- 1) synd-auto-deploy.sh - automated deployment; includes MySQL backup and hostname check to ensure the appropriate syndication files are deployed to their respective servers (See section 1).
- 2) Manual (see section 2). 



Section 1 (Auto deploy script)
The script can be found in the tools from Bitbucket/CTAC/System Administration or go to this URL:
https://bitbucket.org/CTACSYSADMIN/sysadmin_tools/src/d194d89a071715e88271298891153bbe553d3279/hhs-syndication/synd-auto-deploy.sh

The same script is to be run on hhs-syndication-app-01 and hhs-syndication-app-02. The script also assumes that you’ll be deploying the entire syndication stack (all wars). 

******* Be sure to read the prerequisites before running the script!!!!! ********

After reading the prerequisites and doing the necessary steps, run the script as the root user.
Once the script is complete on both servers, go down to the URLs section of this KB and verify the URLs come up.





Section 2 (Manual deployment)
hhs-syndication-app-01.prod.hhs.local
    - syndication storefront as ROOT.war in /appdata/synd/tomcat/webapps
    - syndication as ROOT.war in /appdata/synd/tomcat/webapps_api

hhs-syndication-app-02.prod.hhs.local:
    - cmsmanager as ROOT.war in /appdata/synd/tomcat/webapps_cmsmanager
    - syndication admin as ROOT.war in /appdata/synd/tomcat/webapps_syndicationadmin
    - tinyurl as ROOT.war in /appdata/synd/tomcat/webapps_tinyurl
    - tagcloud as ROOT.war in /appdata/synd/tomcat/webapps_tagcloud

db is -hhhs-rds-shared-java-prod.ctkqhucn2qcz.us-east-1.rds.amazonaws.com
   - it is very important to run mysql_backup cron job (crontab -e  -- as root to find it) on that server prior to deployment.

The .wars for the deployment should be in s3://syndication-wars prior to the deployment


to stop syndication (on both servers):
  /appdata/java-app/tomcat/bin/shutdown.sh
  Historically the shutdown.sh script has not worked so kill -9 is suggested.

be sure, after stopping tomcat (to check if it is still running .. ps -ef | grep tomcat).. if it is .. kill it.  There is/was a know issue where syndication does not shutdown properly. do not assume.

to make a backup of the wars and remove the old web app directories. [as root]

on 01:
bdir=`date +%m%d%y`-wars; mkdir /root/${bdir};cp --parents -p /appdata/synd/tomcat/{webapps,webapps_api}/ROOT.war /root/${bdir}; rm -rf /appdata/synd/tomcat/{webapps,webapps_api}/ROOT

on 02:
bdir=`date +%m%d%y`-wars; mkdir /root/${bdir};cp --parents -p /appdata/synd/tomcat/{webapps_cmsmanager,webapps_syndicationadmin,webapps_tinyurl,webapps_tagcloud}/ROOT.war /root/${bdir};rm -r -f /appdata/synd/tomcat/{webapps_cmsmanager,webapps_syndicationadmin,webapps_tinyurl,webapps_tagcloud}/ROOT

...  move the new wars into the correct webapps dir and rename to ROOT.war

on 01 (from the directory where you downloaded the new wars):
chown synd:synd *.war
rm -rf /appdata/synd/tomcat/{webapps,webapps_api}/ROOT;mv Syndication-*.war /appdata/synd/tomcat/webapps_api/ROOT.war;mv SyndicationStorefront-*.war /appdata/synd/tomcat/webapps/ROOT.war

on 02 ((from the directory where you downloaded the new wars)
chown synd:synd *.war
rm -r -f /appdata/synd/tomcat/{webapps_cmsmanager,webapps_syndicationadmin,webapps_tinyurl,webapps_tagcloud}/ROOT;mv CmsManager-*.war /appdata/synd/tomcat/webapps_cmsmanager/ROOT.war;mv SyndicationAdmin-*.war /appdata/synd/tomcat/webapps_syndicationadmin/ROOT.war;mv TagCloud-*.war /appdata/synd/tomcat/webapps_tagcloud/ROOT.war;mv TinyUrl-*.war /appdata/synd/tomcat/webapps_tinyurl/ROOT.war;

... make any config or other changes required by the deployment

To start (both servers)
  /appdata/java-app/tomcat/bin/startup.sh
  **IMPORTANT: start tomcat as the java-app user: [sudo su - java-app] (DO NOT START SYNDICATION AS ROOT OR ANY OTHER USER)

Be sure to watch the /appdata/java-app/tomcat/logs/catalina.out and the /appdata/syndicationLogs/{apps}/*.logs for issues.

Thumbnail Rendering:
  As of 04/28/2015 Syndication now uses PhantomJS (http://phantomjs.org) and Manet  (https://github.com/vbauer/manet) to render thumbnails.

To start manet in the background, as the java-app user:
cd /appdata/bin/manet/bin
manet --cache 0 ~/.syndication/preview/cache --compresess --cleanup > ~/syndicationLogs/manet.log 2>&1 &



The URLS:

https://api.digitalmedia.hhs.gov 
https://digitalmedia.hhs.gov 
https://cmsmanager.digitalmedia.hhs.gov 
https://syndicationadmin.digitalmedia.hhs.gov 
https://tagcloud.digitalmedia.hhs.gov 
https://tinyurl.digitalmedia.hhs.gov/{number}

Note: to test tinyurl you must pass a number as the first position of the URI:  e.g. https://tinyurl.digitalmedia.hhs.gov/1

Some admin passwords may be contained in 1Password.

If any problems ... contact Zach or Steffen immediately.   There is a private proddeploy slack channel.  Asked to use that channel.


Instructions used for installing Manet/Phantom JS:

As Root user:
  curl -sL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup | sudo bash -
  apt-get install -y nodejs
  npm install npm -g
  apt-get update
  apt-get install -y build-essential chrpath libssl-dev libxft-dev
  apt-get install -y libfreetype6 libfreetype6-dev
  apt-get install -y libfontconfig1 libfontconfig1-dev
  cd ~
  export PHANTOM_JS="phantomjs-1.9.8-linux-x86_64"
  wget https://bitbucket.org/ariya/phantomjs/downloads/$PHANTOM_JS.tar.bz2
  sudo tar xvjf $PHANTOM_JS.tar.bz2
  sudo mv $PHANTOM_JS /usr/local/share
  sudo ln -sf /usr/local/share/$PHANTOM_JS/bin/phantomjs /usr/local/bin
  mkdir -p /appdata/bin
  chown java-app:java-app /appdata/bin
As java-app user:
  cd /appdata/bin
  s3cmd get s3://ctac-migrate/manet.tbz2
  chown java-app:java-app manet.tbz2
  tar -xjvpf manet.tbz2
  export PATH=“appdata/bin/manet/bin:$PATH" >> ~/.profile
  source ~/.profile
  mkdir -p /appdata/synd/.syndication/preview/cache

To test Manet:
 $ manet


Confirm that manet is running. If not, start it with the following command:
manet --cache 0 ~/.syndication/preview/cache --compresess --cleanup > ~/syndicationLogs/manet.log 2>&1 &



——————————————
Misc syndication
——————————————
To start solr, as the root user:
  kill any existing solr processes
  cd /opt
  bin/solr start


To Confirm the version of syndicationadmin
- log into https://api.digitalmedia.hhs.gov/appInfo with admin credentials
- See ‘App Version:’ for the version

=================================================

CTAC.```

item.title: syndication tmp partition full
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Syndication /tmp directory disk full from jpg images

Revision History:
    2016-04-18 10:42:00 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Related:
- manet process

If /tmp is full, and the directory contains lots of *.jpg files, all you need to do is restart manet:
- ssh into the syndication server in question
- switch to the java-app user
sudo su - java-app
- Kill the manet process
- start manet again (be sure it starts as the java-app user):
/appdata/bin/manet/bin/manet --cache 0 ~/.syndication/preview/cache --compresess --cleanup > ~/syndicationLogs/manet.log 2>&1 &
- confirm disk space is reclaimed.```
